meanings.definition: To convert back to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: After the renovation, the family reconverts their old barn into a cozy guest house.
meanings.sent2: She reconverts the spare room into a home office when she starts working from home.
meanings.sent3: The magician reconverts the rabbit back into a hat, much to the audience's delight.
meanings.sent4: The artist reconverts the blank canvas into a masterpiece with each brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar reconverts into a beautiful butterfly, showcasing nature's wonders.

meanings.definition: To change or adapt back to a previous belief or religion.
meanings.sent1: After years of exploration, he reconverts to his childhood faith for comfort.
meanings.sent2: She reconverts to vegetarianism after realizing the impact of meat consumption on the environment.
meanings.sent3: The alien in the movie reconverts to believing in the power of friendship over conquest.
meanings.sent4: The student reconverts to the idea of hard work paying off after seeing his grades improve.
meanings.sent5: The lost soul reconverts to hope after witnessing a beautiful sunrise.
